Detailed Description

cvmx_bgx::_smu::_rx_frm_ctl

This register controls the handling of the frames. The [CTL_BCK] and [CTL_DRP] bits control how the hardware handles incoming PAUSE packets. The most common modes of operation: _ [CTL_BCK] = 1, [CTL_DRP] = 1: hardware handles everything _ [CTL_BCK] = 0, [CTL_DRP] = 0: software sees all PAUSE frames _ [CTL_BCK] = 0, [CTL_DRP] = 1: all PAUSE frames are completely ignored

These control bits should be set to [CTL_BCK] = 0, [CTL_DRP] = 0 in half-duplex mode. Since PAUSE packets only apply to full duplex operation, any PAUSE packet would constitute an exception which should be handled by the processing cores. PAUSE packets should not be forwarded.
